alert.note: Alert for Onondaga; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cayuga and southern Onondaga Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marcellus, or 11 miles east of Auburn, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain will reduce visibility while driving. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Pompey, Solvay, Owasco, Fleming, Otisco, Skaneateles, Locke and Marcellus. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 14 and 23, 24A and B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
